meanings.definition: A small piece of land used for gardening.
meanings.sent1: I planted colorful flowers in my plottie.
meanings.sent2: The community garden has many plotties for residents to grow vegetables.
meanings.sent3: The plottie looked like a tiny rainbow with all the different flowers.
meanings.sent4: Her plottie was a canvas of green and yellow, like a painting.
meanings.sent5: The plottie was a peaceful oasis in the bustling city.

meanings.definition: To divide or distribute into plots.
meanings.sent1: She will plottie the field into sections for different crops.
meanings.sent2: The real estate agent will plottie the land for development.
meanings.sent3: He tried to plottie the cake into equal slices, but they ended up uneven.
meanings.sent4: The detective will plottie the clues to solve the mystery.
meanings.sent5: The teacher will plottie the students into groups for the project.

meanings.sent1: The farmer owned a vast plottie where he grew corn.
meanings.sent2: They bought a plottie in the countryside to build their dream home.
meanings.sent3: The plottie by the river was a popular spot for picnics.
meanings.sent4: The plottie stretched as far as the eye could see, covered in crops.
meanings.sent5: The plottie was a gift from her grandparents, filled with memories.
